name: List repository projects

previews.name: inertia
previews.description:
The Projects API is currently available for developers to preview. During the preview period, the API may change without advance notice. Please see the [blog post](/changes/2016-10-27-changes-to-projects-api) for full details. To access the API during the preview period, you must provide a custom [media type](/enterprise/2.12/v3/media) in the `Accept` header:

```
  application/vnd.github.inertia-preview+json

```

params.name: state
params.description: Indicates the state of the projects to return. Can be either `open`, `closed`, or `all`.

params.name: per_page
params.description: Results per page (max 100)

params.name: page
params.description: Page number of the results to fetch.

description: **Note**: The status code may also be `401` or `410`, depending on the scope of the authenticating token.

body.name: Projects Documentation
body.body: Developer documentation project for the developer site.

name: Create a project card

previews.name: inertia
previews.description:
The Projects API is currently available for developers to preview. During the preview period, the API may change without advance notice. Please see the [blog post](/changes/2016-10-27-changes-to-projects-api) for full details. To access the API during the preview period, you must provide a custom [media type](/enterprise/2.12/v3/media) in the `Accept` header:

```
  application/vnd.github.inertia-preview+json

```

params.name: note
params.description: The card's note content. Only valid for cards without another type of content, so you must omit when specifying `content_id` and `content_type`.

params.name: content_id
params.description:
The issue or pull request id you want to associate with this card. You can use the [List issues for a repository](/enterprise/2.12/v3/issues/#list-issues-for-a-repository) and [List pull requests](/enterprise/2.12/v3/pulls/#list-pull-requests) endpoints to find this id.  
**Note:** Depending on whether you use the issue id or pull request id, you will need to specify `Issue` or `PullRequest` as the `content_type`.

params.name: content_type
params.description: **Required if you provide `content_id`**. The type of content you want to associate with this card. Use `Issue` when `content_id` is an issue id and use `PullRequest` when `content_id` is a pull request id.

description:
**Note**: GitHub's REST API v3 considers every pull request an issue, but not every issue is a pull request. For this reason, "Issues" endpoints may return both issues and pull requests in the response. You can identify pull requests by the `pull_request` key.

Be aware that the `id` of a pull request returned from "Issues" endpoints will be an _issue id_. To find out the pull request id, use the "[List pull requests](/enterprise/2.12/v3/pulls/#list-pull-requests)" endpoint.

body.note: Add payload for delete Project column

previews.description:
The Projects API is currently available for developers to preview. During the preview period, the API may change without advance notice. ```

params.name: note
params.description: The card's note content. Only valid for cards without another type of content, so this cannot be specified if the card already has a `content_id` and `content_type`.

params.name: position
params.description: Can be one of `top`, `bottom`, or `after:<card_id>`, where `<card_id>` is the `id` value of a card in the same column, or in the new column specified by `column_id`.

params.name: column_id
params.description: The `id` value of a column in the same project.
